parents.father: father executed as witch ~25 years earlier

confession.seduction_context: Persin promised him money (which turned out to be oak leaves)

devil_mark.description: Said the devil had touched him on the forehead which prevented him from returning to God

sabbat_activities: making hail and wind to spoil crops
said 'Jesus Maria' and everything disappeared at first sabbat

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused asked him to put his dog after a hare

harms_alleged.target: horses strangled in fields by night

testimony.quarrel_subject: Competition for cattle-keeping position at Barbas - Noel outbid witness
Husband spoke ill of Noel at Barbas so he did not get custody of cattle
Communal hedges dispute - accused cut section belonging to witness who took wood away
testimony.threat_quote: it would be expensive wood for him

testimony.quarrel_subject: Witness refused to do some ploughing for accused

testimony.threat_quote: threatened to do him much harm (warning from late Aulbertin le Here)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Competition for keeping of herd - witness outbid accused
testimony.threat_quote: wished him 500 wolves among his herd

harms_alleged.target: herd animals became frightened and made strange noise

testimony.quarrel_subject: Wife called accused son of a witch when animal fell in ditch

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: when he lost keeping of herd previous year

witnesses.name: Jean Valtrin le vieux
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: mayor who participated in father's trial

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused bore particular hatred because witness was imbalt at time of father's execution and took part in case

witnesses.name: Margueritte veuve Aubertin Leher
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: widow of man who accused Noel of theft

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband charged Noel with stealing purse with 16 francs, Noel was beaten and taken to court

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for depositions, noting accused has been arrested to prevent possibility of flight

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - no reproaches, continued to deny charges

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - resisted thumbscrews but confessed when racked

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to reiteration of confessions

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Renewed confessions but withdrew all accusations, saying he did those concerned wrong

timeline.subject: Noel Raimbault
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Blamont

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte Vaultrin femme Nicolas de Barbac
Claudatte femme Colas Mariatte
accomplices_named.context: Sister of Claudatte Vaultrin, seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: la grande Chretienne veuve Petit Colas

prior_accusations.context: Father executed as witch approximately 20-25 years earlier; reputation as witch began after father's execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Raimbault
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne peut, et qu'il estime que ce que le malin l'avoit touché au front l'en empeschoit
notable_quotes.english: that he cannot [return to God], and that he believes that the evil one had touched him on the forehead which prevented him
notable_quotes.context: Asked during torture why he had not returned to God

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Raimbault
notable_quotes.context: What he said when he saw large numbers of people at first sabbat, causing everything to disappear

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Raimbault (when drunk)
notable_quotes.french: si c'est vray ce que les prêtres dise, nre loy estoit faubce
notable_quotes.english: if what the priests say is true, our law was false
notable_quotes.context: Reported by Jean Vaultrin at confrontations

notable_quotes.speaker: Noel Raimbault
notable_quotes.french: ne crains pas je ne te fera rien
notable_quotes.english: don't be afraid I will do nothing to you
notable_quotes.context: Response to Jean Vaultrin after making heretical statement

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Olry (to Noel's wife)
notable_quotes.english: if misfortune followed he would have him treated as his father had been
notable_quotes.context: Threat after Noel wished 500 wolves among his herd

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Olry
notable_quotes.english: he had heard how as a boy he talked of making hail
notable_quotes.context: Public accusation made 10 years earlier; Noel never sought reparation

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal's wife
notable_quotes.english: he was son of a witch
notable_quotes.context: Called Noel son of witch when animal fell in ditch

relationships.evidence_text: father executed as a witch some 25 years earlier

relationships.person1: Claudatte Vaultrin femme Nicolas de Barbac
relationships.evidence_text: her sister Claudatte femme Colas Mariatte
Curien Marchal of Reillon was 'partie plaindante' in case

economic_context.details: Much of the conflict centers on Noel's occupation as herdsman - multiple witnesses competed with him for lucrative positions keeping village herds and cattle. The hedge-cutting dispute with Dieudenon Claude indicates property boundary conflicts. The theft accusation by Aubertin Leher (purse with 16 francs) led to legal proceedings that were expensive for Noel.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Dog became useless for hunting after catching hare multiple times but unable to bring it down; previously was excellent hunter
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused asked witness to put dog after hare

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horses strangled in fields by night
Dog became all swollen and died in 6 weeks; was excellent for keeping animals
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Competition for cattle-keeping position at Barbas - Noel outbid witness and appeared angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow fell sick, Noel as herdsman said not serious but died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Communal hedges dispute - Noel cut section belonging to witness who took wood away; Aulbry Austette warned it would be expensive wood

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horses suddenly took fright, one died and others affected since; witness now only had 4 horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness refused to do some ploughing for accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow sickened, accused did not warn witness as herdsman should have, died in fields next day
Heifer sick, accused as herdsman said not serious but died next day
Horse bought at St Dié sickened, recovered after given piece of lard
Lost 4 horses without knowing cause
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Late Aulbertin le Here warned that Noel threatened to do much harm

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost 3 cattle without knowing cause
Animals became so frightened they made a strange noise
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness outbid accused for keeping of herd; accused wished 500 wolves among herd

harms_catalog.harm_description: Child sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness told Noel's wife he would have him treated as his father if misfortune followed after threats

harms_catalog.harm_description: Son died after being ill for a week
Animal fell in ditch
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife called accused son of witch during incident

harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of heifer
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: When he lost keeping of herd previous year

harms_catalog.harm_description: 2 horses died on same day
Death of 2 animals
harms_catalog.method_alleged: visited them, said illness not serious in one case

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost 2 chickens
Pig died after Noel mentioned it
Death of horse
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness participated in father's trial as imbalt, accused bore particular hatred

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, bedridden 15 months with flesh dropping off to expose bones, finally died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband accused Noel of stealing purse with 16 francs, Noel was beaten and taken to court

harms_catalog.harm_description: 2 horses killed
Master forced him to agree to breaking the thigh of a cow belonging to curé
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Master wanted harm to curé's property, Noel was angry with curé's servants but didn't want to harm curé
harms_catalog.method_alleged: devil in form of ox forced agreement

material_culture.context: Given to sick horse which then recovered
Devil promised money but it was actually oak leaves
Claimed pact exempted him from using it
Noel accused of stealing from Aubertin Leher
Aubertin Leher and accused charged by community with taking them to Badonviller for cleaning
Dispute over cutting and sharing; wood taken away
Dog unable to bring down hare despite catching it several times

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused
Location where cattle-keeping position was contested
Where Demenge Geoffroy bought a horse
Where muskets were taken for cleaning
Location of court that issued torture sentence and death sentence
Location of Change de Nancy that approved torture and death sentence
Home of Jean de Benamesnil (named accomplice)
Where horses were strangled at night; where cattle died
Where accused claimed to have been transported after seduction

economic_hardship_indicators: poverty mentioned - accused said both he and Aubertin Leher were poor and rich took no notice
competition for herdsman positions indicates economic pressure
religious_calendar_references: Good Friday - pact to give master an animal every Good Friday

prior_legal_disputes.description: Accused of stealing purse with 16 francs from Aubertin Leher; was beaten across back and taken to court
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Eventually made accord before justice; was expensive for accused

legal_context.redress_outcome: Nicolas Olry publicly accused him as boy of talking about making hail; Noel never sought reparation for this. He was angry when Nicolas Olry called him witch and said he ought to beat him until he left him on the place.

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Change de Nancy approved both torture (2 May 1624) and death sentence (6 May 1624) subject to reiteration of confessions

hearsay_chains.content: warned him that Noel threatened to do him much harm
heard that inhabitants wanted someone to keep their cattle

emotional_state_notes: angry because Nicolas Olry called him witch
said both he and Aubertin Leher were poor and rich took no notice (explaining why he asked after sick man)

third_parties.name: Aulbry Austette (cousin of Dieudenon Claude)
third_parties.context: Warned Dieudenon Claude that wood would be expensive; also testified as witness 8

third_parties.name: Aulbertin le Here
third_parties.context: Warned Aulbry Austette that Noel threatened harm; accused Noel of theft; died of terrible wasting illness

third_parties.name: Curien Marchal
third_parties.context: Named as 'partie plaindante' in torture sentence from court at Blamont

third_parties.name: Noel's wife
third_parties.context: Nicolas Olry told her he would have Noel treated as his father if misfortune followed

third_parties.name: Curé
third_parties.context: Master wanted Noel to harm curé's property but Noel resisted because of benefits received from curé; master broke thigh of curé's cow

third_parties.name: Curé's servants
third_parties.context: Noel had been angry with them

third_parties.name: Claudon Marchal's wife
third_parties.context: Called Noel son of witch when animal fell in ditch

third_parties.name: Claudon Bastien's late father
third_parties.context: Suspected Noel over 2 horses which died on same day

third_parties.name: Nicolas Olry's two children
third_parties.context: 3-month-old and 5-year-old sons who died after threats

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony. The accused is the son of an executed witch, which clearly influenced his reputation from childhood. The trial centers heavily on his role as herdsman and the economic competition this created. Notable that he withdrew his accusations of accomplices after confessing under torture, saying he 'did those concerned wrong.' The confession contains the typical sabbat narrative but also unique elements like saying 'Jesus Maria' causing the sabbat to disappear, and making a pact to give the devil an animal every Good Friday in exchange for not attending more sabbats or using powder.
